item.title: Newton-Raphson method
item.author: William
item.description: Introduction The Newton iteration method, as the name suggests, is a method proposed by Newton for solving approximate solutions to equations. This article mainly introduces the principle of Newton’s iterative method and its application in solving square roots. Theory Assuming an approximate solution of equation $f(x)=0$ is $x_k$，the first-order Taylor expansion of $f(x)$ in $x_k$ is $f(x)=f(x_k)+f'(x_k)(x-x_k)+o(x)$，so $f(x_k)+f'(x_k)(x-x_k) \approx f(x)$.
